etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Appletons' Journal. From paedo- + -logy

definitions: The study of the growth and (especially mental, social, or educational) development of children; child psychology.

notes.text: This approach to child development was a particular characteristic of educational psychology in Russia and the Soviet Union in the early part of the 20th century, but all forms of pedology were banned there in the 1930s.
